summary.en: GitHubStarsIndex automatically harvests all repositories youâ€™ve starred, reads each README, and uses any OpenAI-compatible endpoint (OpenAI/Azure/Ollama) to generate bilingual AI summaries and high-signal tech tags. Results are stored in a data/stars.json index for fast search and downstream tooling. It supports incremental processing to avoid repeated API costs, concurrency to speed up large backlogs, and Jinja2-based rendering to Markdown and an interactive HTML page. GitHub Actions scheduling enables hands-free refresh, with optional syncing to an Obsidian Vault repo and GitHub Pages deployment.

summary.en: This repo is a reference/template for building a Three.js + Capacitor (iOS/desktop) 3D experience using AI-assisted workflows. It ships agent â€œskillsâ€ for Claude Code and Codex CLI covering scene setup, GLTF/GLB loading, animation mixing, and Capacitor iOS integration. It also includes the step-by-step prompts used to generate characters, backgrounds, voices, and scenes, plus an assets_index.json that formalizes an animation metadata contract (clip names, durations, loop modes, crossfades) for wiring custom GLB characters into a maintainable animation/state pipeline.

summary.en: Gemini Business2API turns Gemini Business into an OpenAI-compatible API, enabling drop-in use with existing OpenAI tooling. It provides multi-account load balancing with rotation and automatic failover, plus automated account onboarding/login and proxy configuration. The gateway supports rich multimodal inputs across 100+ file types (images, PDFs, Office docs, audio, video, code) with streaming responses. It also exposes dedicated Imagen-based image generation and Veo-based video generation, and ships with an admin dashboard and SQLite/PostgreSQL persistence for settings, accounts, and stats.

summary.en: An AI film-production studio for short dramas and comic videos, providing an end-to-end, controllable pipeline: novel/script analysis, automatic storyboard generation, consistent character and scene image creation, multi-role voice synthesis, and final video composition. Itâ€™s designed to mimic a professional â€œvirtual production setâ€ workflow, enabling faster iteration from text to finished episodes. The system is containerized for quick local deployment via Docker Compose, and includes a settings center to integrate external AI model APIs for text, image, and voice generation.

summary.en: X Feed Digest is an open-source pipeline that turns your X/Twitter following list into an AI-curated daily brief. Upload an exported CSV, then it pulls the past 24 hours of tweets via Grok (OpenAI-compatible API) using concurrent batching for speed and resilience. Collected content is summarized and structured by Claude with editorial-grade prompts into highlights, categories, and a rated tweet list. A FastAPI backend plus a Vue 3/TypeScript UI provides live progress, job history, and downloadable tweet archives.

summary.en: This repo ships a Claude Code Skill packaged as a plugin that lets Claude generate and run Playwright automation on demand. It targets everything from quick page checks to complex endâ€‘toâ€‘end multi-step flows for testing and validation, with a visible browser by default. A universal executor avoids common Node module-resolution pitfalls, while progressive disclosure loads only the needed API reference. Smart temp-file cleanup and optional helpers improve reliability and keep custom, model-written scripts maintainable.

summary.en: This repo ships a single CLAUDE.md (also installable as a Claude Code plugin) that hardens LLM coding behavior using four principles: think before coding, simplicity first, surgical changes, and goal-driven execution with explicit success criteria and tests. It targets common failure modes like silent assumptions, overengineering, and collateral edits. Ideal for teams operationalizing AI-assisted development to improve reliability, maintainability, and reviewability of generated code.

summary.en: A practical guide to Context Engineering for building LLM applications. It formalizes the idea of selecting, structuring, and injecting only the most task-relevant information into a limited context window. The repo breaks context into seven types and maps them to concrete Agent modules, clarifying how relevant context differs from user memory and how RAG is only a subset of the broader system. It also outlines backend design patterns, tool definitions/outputs, conversation history management, and structured output constraints with real-world examples.

summary.en: GSD is a lightweight meta-prompting and context-engineering system for Claude Code, OpenCode, Gemini CLI, and Codex. It targets â€œcontext rotâ€ by structuring work as spec-driven development: capturing intent, generating executable plans, implementing changes, and verifying outcomes with consistent prompt formatting (XML), sub-agent orchestration, and state management. The result is more reliable AI-assisted coding at scaleâ€”less drift, fewer regressions, and clearer end-to-end traceability from requirements to testsâ€”optimized for solo builders and fast product iteration.

metadata.name: superpowers
metadata.description: An agentic skills framework & software development methodology that works.

summary.zh: Superpowersæ˜¯é¢å‘ç¼–ç ä»£ç†çš„æŠ€èƒ½åŒ–å¼€å‘æ–¹æ³•ï¼šå¯¹è¯æ¾„æ¸…éœ€æ±‚â†’åˆ†æ®µè®¾è®¡ç¡®è®¤â†’å¯æ‰§è¡Œä»»åŠ¡è®¡åˆ’â†’git worktreeéš”ç¦»â†’å­ä»£ç†é€é¡¹å®ç°ã€‚å¼ºåˆ¶çº¢ç»¿TDDã€YAGNI/DRYä¸ä¸¤é˜¶æ®µè¯„å®¡ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºClaude/Cursor/Codexç­‰è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–äº¤ä»˜ã€‚
summary.en: Superpowers is an agentic skills framework and end-to-end development methodology for coding agents. Instead of jumping straight into code, it elicits a clear spec through conversation, presents a digestible design for approval, then generates a concrete implementation plan with exact files and verification steps. Execution follows subagent-driven development with per-task reviews, uses Git worktrees for isolation, and enforces true red/green TDD plus YAGNI and DRY. It installs as plugins or instructions across Claude Code, Cursor, Codex, and OpenCode.

summary.en: A Windows directory migration tool designed to relocate large folders to another drive while keeping the original path intact via directory symlinks (mklink /D). It mirrors data with robocopy to preserve ACLs, timestamps, and attributes, and reports real-time progress, speed, and ETA. The project offers both a PowerShell CLI and a modern .NET 8 WPF GUI, plus safety features like path validation, disk space checks, automatic rollback, one-click restore, and a repair mode to rebuild links without copying.

summary.en: Skills Hub is a cross-platform desktop app built with Tauri and React that centralizes Agent Skills management and syncs them to the global skills directories of many AI coding tools. It prefers symlink/junction-based linking for â€œinstall once, sync everywhereâ€, with copy-mode as a fallback. The app can scan installed tools to migrate existing skills into a central repo, import from local folders or Git URLs (including multi-skill repo selection), refresh skills from their sources, and propagate updates to copy-mode targets. It also detects newly installed tools and prompts for syncing.

summary.en: Droid Resource Manager is a desktop hub built with Electron, React, and Vite to centrally manage Droids, Skills, MCP, Prompts, and Rules. It scans resources from ~/.factory and per-project .factory, supports manual initialization to refresh cache, enables droid create/clone and drag-and-drop organization, provides skill CRUD with on-demand AI interpretation, and offers MCP service/tool browsing. Import/export, settings, and a resource marketplace make it practical for local and multi-project AI asset governance.

metadata.name: dexter
metadata.description: An autonomous agent for deep financial research

summary.zh: Dexter æ˜¯é¢å‘æ·±åº¦æŠ•ç ”çš„è‡ªä¸»æ™ºèƒ½ä½“ï¼Œå¯å°†å¤æ‚é‡‘èé—®é¢˜æ‹†è§£ä¸ºç ”ç©¶è®¡åˆ’å¹¶è‡ªåŠ¨æ‰§è¡Œï¼Œç»“åˆå®æ—¶è´¢æŠ¥/å¸‚åœºæ•°æ®ä¸å¯é€‰ç½‘ç»œæ£€ç´¢ï¼ŒæŒç»­è‡ªæˆ‘åæ€ä¸æ ¡éªŒè¿­ä»£äº§å‡ºå¯è¿½æº¯ç»“è®ºï¼›å†…ç½®å¾ªç¯æ£€æµ‹ã€æ­¥éª¤ä¸Šé™ç­‰å®‰å…¨æœºåˆ¶ï¼Œå¹¶æä¾›åŸºäº LangSmith çš„è¯„æµ‹å¥—ä»¶ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºæŠ•ç ”é—®ç­”ã€è´¢åŠ¡åˆ†æä¸ç ”ç©¶è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–ã€‚
summary.en: Dexter is an autonomous agent purpose-built for deep financial research. It converts complex finance questions into step-by-step plans, executes them with tool selection, and refines answers through self-reflection and self-validation. The agent integrates real-time financial statements and market data, with optional web search for broader context. Safety controls such as loop detection and step limits prevent runaway execution. It also includes an evaluation suite using LangSmith tracking and LLM-as-a-judge scoring, making it suitable for repeatable, data-backed research workflows.

metadata.name: pyCapCut
metadata.description: A lightweight, flexible, and easy-to-use Python tool for generating and exporting CapCut drafts to build fully automated video editing/remix pipelines! Another similar project: https://github.com/GuanYixuan/pyJianYingDraft

summary.zh: pyCapCut æ˜¯é¢å‘ CapCut çš„ Python è‰ç¨¿ç”Ÿæˆä¸å¯¼å‡ºåº“ï¼šåŠ è½½/å¤åˆ¶æ¨¡æ¿ draft_content.jsonï¼Œæ›¿æ¢ç´ æä¸æ–‡æœ¬ï¼Œç¼–æ’å¤šè½¨é“ã€è½¬åœºã€ç‰¹æ•ˆã€å…³é”®å¸§å’Œ SRT å­—å¹•ï¼Œå¹¶é©±åŠ¨æ‰¹é‡å¯¼å‡ºã€‚é€‚åˆè‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–å‰ªè¾‘ã€æ··å‰ªä¸å†…å®¹å·¥å‚æµæ°´çº¿ï¼Œæä¾›ç´ æå…ƒæ•°æ®æå–ä¸æ˜“ç”¨ APIã€‚
summary.en: pyCapCut is a Python library for programmatically generating and exporting CapCut drafts, enabling fully automated editing and remix pipelines. It supports template-driven workflows by loading and duplicating existing draft_content.json files, then replacing media assets and text while preserving complex styling. You can build timelines with multi-tracks, transitions, effects, filters, animations, keyframes, stickers, audio controls, and SRT subtitle import. It also offers material metadata inspection (resource_id) for reusable assets. Drafts can be authored cross-platform, but export is done via Windows CapCut.

metadata.name: MiniMax-MCP

summary.zh: MiniMax å®˜æ–¹ MCP æœåŠ¡å™¨ï¼Œéµå¾ª Model Context Protocol å°†è¯­éŸ³åˆæˆã€å›¾åƒä¸è§†é¢‘ç”Ÿæˆ API å°è£…ä¸ºæ ‡å‡†åŒ–å·¥å…·ï¼Œä¾› Claude/IDE ç­‰ MCP å®¢æˆ·ç«¯ç»Ÿä¸€è°ƒç”¨ï¼›æä¾›é‰´æƒã€å‚æ•°æ ¡éªŒä¸å¯ç¼–æ’çš„å¤šæ¨¡æ€å·¥ä½œæµèƒ½åŠ›ï¼Œä¾¿äºå¿«é€Ÿæ­å»ºå†…å®¹ç”Ÿæˆä¸è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–ä»£ç†åº”ç”¨ã€‚
summary.en: Official MiniMax MCP server that implements the Model Context Protocol to expose MiniMax Text-to-Speech, image generation, and video generation APIs as standardized tools. It lets any MCP-compatible client (e.g., desktop assistants or IDE agents) discover and invoke multimodal capabilities through a consistent schema, while handling authentication, request/response validation, and tool orchestration. Ideal for building agent workflows that generate voiceovers, images, and videos, and for integrating MiniMaxâ€™s multimodal stack into existing LLM toolchains with minimal glue code.

summary.en: MossX is an open-source, nextâ€‘gen VibeCoding platform inspired by CodexMonitor. It integrates multiple coding AIs (e.g., Claude Code, Codex, Gemini, OpenCode) and works across desktop, VS Code, JetBrains IDEs, and mobile. Beyond chat sessions, it provides sidebar Git and file management with in-place editing, terminal/CLI views, and a standout panel mode that runs truly parallel tasks with interactive AI panels. An extensible ecosystem (AI Memory, OpenSpec, specâ€‘kit) aims to accelerate collaborative software delivery.

summary.en: A full-featured temporary email service built on Cloudflareâ€™s free Workers/Pages stack, enabling zero-cost deployment of a temp-domain mailbox. It supports sending/receiving emails, attachments, IMAP/SMTP access for mail clients, and Telegram Bot notifications for real-time alerts. Mail parsing is implemented with Rust + WASM for fast, efficient processing. The project also provides a modern, responsive, multilingual web UI, and can enable per-address passwords to improve isolation and security when sharing or rotating inboxes.

summary.en: Sanshu is a cross-platform Rust binary that packages a suite of MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools for AI-assisted programming. It centers on three modules: zhi for interactive decisions and multimodal inputs, ji for global memory with categorization and deduplication, and sou for semantic search with incremental indexing and file watching. It also integrates Context7 documentation lookup plus built-in icon and UI/UX utilities. Ideal for MCP-compatible assistants/IDEs to enable proactive, workflow-oriented collaboration beyond simple Q&A.

Its canonical Team mode runs a staged pipeline (plan â†’ PRD â†’ exec â†’ verify â†’ fix loop) to converge on validated code changes. From v4.4.0+, it can spawn real Codex, Gemini, and Claude CLI workers inside tmux split panes for parallel review, security analysis, UI/UX work, and implementation. Ideal for accelerating collaborative debugging, refactors, and delivery.

summary.en: GoSubTTS is a cross-platform desktop app built with Go and Wails, designed for plug-and-play voiceover generation and subtitle extraction. It integrates Microsoft Edge TTS for high-quality multilingual speech synthesis without API keys, while producing perfectly aligned SRT subtitles. For transcription, it bundles whisper.cpp for fully offline ASR with strong performance, supporting CUDA acceleration on Windows and Metal on Apple Silicon. Built-in FFmpeg enables direct import of common audio/video formats, prioritizing privacy and zero-configuration workflows.

summary.en: A Codex/Claude skill for aggressive web research using an OpenAI-compatible Grok (2api) endpoint. It performs real-time web searches and returns structured JSON with a synthesized answer plus cited source URLs/titles, making it ideal for version checks, documentation lookups, and troubleshooting. The repo includes a one-click PowerShell installer, interactive/manual configuration, environment-variable support, and a gitignored local config for safely overriding API keys and headers. Timeouts, extra request bodies, and custom headers are configurable for different gateways.

summary.en: OpenClaw Mini is a minimal TypeScript re-implementation of OpenClawâ€™s core agent architecture for system-level learning. It goes beyond a simple agent loop by providing a dual-loop execution model with a typed EventStream, JSONL session persistence with session-key scoping, and a command queue for per-session serialization. It also demonstrates on-demand context loading, multi-stage pruning and adaptive compaction, tool abstractions, long-term memory retrieval, skill triggering, and a heartbeat-based proactive wake scheduler, plus multi-provider LLM adapters.

summary.en: Universal DB MCP is a universal database connector for AI assistants, exposing databases via MCP and an HTTP API so users can query and analyze data in natural language across 17 engines. It supports stdio/http modes and multiple transports (MCP stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP, REST). Security features include read-only by default and automatic sensitive-data masking. Performance is boosted with schema caching and batched metadata fetching (up to 100Ã— faster), plus schema enrichment (comments and inferred relations) to improve Text2SQL accuracy. Works with 55+ clients.

summary.en: GrokSearch is a FastMCP-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that brings Grok-style, OpenAI-compatible real-time web search and page fetching into Claude and Claude Code. It returns AI-friendly structured JSON (title, link, summary), supports platform-scoped searches (e.g., Twitter/Reddit/GitHub), and includes config diagnostics with safe key masking. It also enables persistent model switching and tool routing to disable built-in WebSearch/WebFetch, improving freshness, citation, and fact-checking workflows.

summary.en: Trellis is an all-in-one AI engineering framework and CLI toolkit for Claude Code, Cursor, Gemini CLI, Codex, and more. It auto-injects your Markdown specs and workflows into every session, turning best practices into a living, auto-updated spec library. Trellis also enables parallel agent sessions via isolated Git worktrees, while persisting traces and context inside your repo for continuity. With team sync, one developerâ€™s patterns become shared standards across the codebase.

summary.en: baoyu-skills is an installable skill set for Claude Code, delivered as marketplace plugins in a Node.js environment (npx/bun). It streamlines content production with generators for RedNote (Xiaohongshu) infographic series, cover images, comics, and slide decks, plus publishing helpers for X and WeChat. It also bundles AI generation backends and practical utilities such as URL-to-Markdown conversion, image compression, and Markdown formatting. A style Ã— layout system enables fast, consistent visual outputs.

summary.en: QuantDinger is an AI-native, local-first quantitative trading platform spanning research, backtesting, and live execution. It uses multiple AI agents to turn natural-language trading ideas into Python strategies, then run backtests and place live orders with minimal frictionâ€”great for both non-coders and quants. The system supports 10+ exchanges/brokers and is easy to self-host via Docker. A privacy-first design keeps API keys and strategies on your own machine/server, improving security, control, and reproducibility.

summary.en: Huobao Drama is an end-to-end AI short drama production platform built with Go (Gin) + Vue 3 and a DDD layered architecture. It turns a single sentence or script into structured characters, scenes, and storyboards via LLM parsing, then generates portraits/backgrounds (text-to-image) and clips (image-to-video / text-to-video), finally composing videos with FFmpeg. The system includes asset library management, import/export, local storage, and task progress tracking, enabling scalable short-drama creation for marketing, rapid prototyping, and batch content production.

summary.en: XHS-RS-TOOLS is a Rust API backend plus a Python signing agent for reverse-engineering and automating Xiaohongshu (XHS) web endpoints. It uses a Dockerized undetected-chromedriver to bootstrap legitimate guest cookies, then relies on a â€œpure algorithmâ€ real-time signature service to satisfy strict cookie/header/X-S binding checks with minimal browser usage. The toolkit supports QR login flows, full search and feed crawling, note details and comments, and media extraction for videos and image notes with direct CDN links and server-side downloading.

summary.en: An agentic workflow that validates business ideas using Xiaohongshu signals. It scrapes relevant posts and comments from a user-provided query, then applies LLM-driven analysis to extract pain points, unmet needs, sentiment, user feedback, and competitive cues. The system performs post analysis, comment analysis, tag mining, and a combined scoring step, finally producing a structured market validation report. Checkpointed stages and an orchestrated multi-agent pipeline make runs reproducible and easy to iterate for product discovery, niche research, and go-to-market planning.

It aggregates multi-source quotes and real-time financial news to produce a decision dashboard with actionable entry/exit levels, stop-loss/targets, and a rule-based checklist. The system includes an interactive â€œask-a-strategyâ€ agent (multiple built-in trading methods) plus automated backtesting to validate signal quality. It runs on schedules via GitHub Actions (no server needed) and pushes reports to WeCom, Feishu, Telegram, email, and more.

summary.en: GitHub Skill Forge automates turning any GitHub repository into a standardized â€œskillâ€ for AI assistants (e.g., Trae). It scans repos via the GitHub API in a zero-clone, cloud-first mode, then applies smart RAG-style filtering to remove noise and extract the essential code and docs into a compact context_bundle.md plus a ready-to-use skill folder. Built-in API mirror rotation, multi-thread fetching, and basic quality heuristics (stars/activity) help bypass rate limits and avoid low-quality repos.

summary.en: GudaStudio Commands is a curated set of custom commands for Claude Code. Its flagship workflow, gudaspec, operationalizes the RPI (Researchâ€“Planâ€“Implementation) methodology, integrates OpenSpec outputs, and orchestrates multi-model collaboration via MCP (e.g., Codex and Gemini) to handle complex, long-running coding tasks. The design emphasizes human-in-the-loop context management: users deliberately split stages and clear context between runs to maximize the effective ~80K context budget. The repo includes cross-platform installers and step-by-step usage demos.

summary.en: VAlpha Terminal is an AI-powered analytics terminal for China A-shares, combining portfolio management, fund pool analysis, watchlist monitoring, commodities tracking, news aggregation, and market-sentiment signals. It ingests data via AkShare/TuShare with optional caching, and uses APScheduler to automate pre-market and post-market report generation plus email alerts. The system integrates multiple LLM backends (Gemini, OpenAI, and compatible endpoints) to produce professional narratives. Built as a full-stack app with FastAPI and a React/TypeScript dashboard with i18n support.

summary.en: An LLM-driven quantitative trading simulation arena. It connects to stock market quotes, lets you manage multiple trading agents, and replays trades with detailed transaction and API logs. The platform includes prompt templates, model channels, and side-by-side model comparisons to evaluate strategy quality across different LLMs. Built with a FastAPI backend (Python 3.10+) plus MySQL and Redis, and a Vite-based frontend. Cross-platform one-click deploy scripts and Docker Compose simplify local setup and operations.

summary.en: Webnovel Writer is a Claude Codeâ€“compatible assistant for long-form serialized fiction (up to ~2M words), designed to reduce LLM â€œforgettingâ€ and hallucinations. It enforces outline-as-law and canon-as-physics, automatically extracts new entities into a managed knowledge base, and retrieves facts via RAG. A dual-agent design (Context/Data) plus parallel reviewers (consistency, pacing, OOC, coherence, hook payoff) provides continual validation. Python scripts maintain state, indexes, and vectors for durable, recoverable workflows.

summary.en: AI Global is a unified configuration manager for multiple AI coding assistants. It centralizes AGENTS.md and shared skills/rules/commands into one directory, then syncs each supported tool via symlinks. With automatic context detection, it works in both system-wide and per-project modes without manual switching. On first run it scans installed tools, backs up original configs, merges existing assets, and updates links. It can also import skills from GitHub repos, making it ideal for consistent workflows across tools and teams.

summary.en: PromptX is a full-stack prompt management platform designed for AI workflows. It combines prompt CRUD with nested categorization, advanced tagging, global search, and one-click copy. Its standout feature is built-in version control with auto snapshots, diff comparison, and rollback. PromptX also includes a community template library for sharing and importing prompts, plus ratings, comments, moderation tools, and real-time WebSocket notifications. Built with FastAPI, MongoDB, and a React/TypeScript frontend, it fits individuals and teams building reusable prompt assets.

summary.en: All API Hub is a browser extension for managing New-API/One-API compatible relay accounts in one place. It aggregates multi-site balances, usage and health status, supports auto check-in, centralized API key management, and one-click exports to popular AI clients and routers. It also provides in-page API/model availability tests, usage analytics with latency views, and admin utilities for self-hosted panels such as channel creation, model sync, and model redirect, reducing repetitive dashboard work.

summary.en: OpenSpec is a spec-driven development framework built for AI coding assistants. It provides an artifact-guided workflow that turns an idea into structured deliverablesâ€”proposal, requirements/scenarios, design, and an implementation task listâ€”then drives execution via commands like /opsx:propose, /opsx:apply, and /opsx:archive. Designed to be iterative and lightweight, it works well on brownfield codebases and scales from solo projects to teams. Distributed as a Node.js CLI via npm and supports 20+ AI tools.

summary.en: Interactive Prompt Iterator is a Next.js + AI SDK web tool that turns vague ideas into structured, high-quality prompts through multi-turn guided dialogue. It accelerates prompt engineering with visual forms, selectable requirement dimensions, and reusable template management for one-click application. The app also supports parsing PDFs and images to incorporate complex source materials into prompt design. It fits workflows such as content creation, requirement clarification, and building reliable AI-assisted products with repeatable prompts.

summary.en: Kuaitu (vue-fabric-editor) is a Vue + Fabric.js based, plugin-driven canvas image editor built for drag-and-drop design rather than a heavy â€œonline PSâ€. It offers layers, history/undo, guides and rulers, gradients and filters, plus context menus and hotkeys that can be extended via plugins. It imports PSD/JSON and exports PNG/SVG/JSON, and supports custom fonts, assets and templates. Typical use cases include poster/banner creation, template-based marketing creatives, and product/print-on-demand DIY designers.

summary.en: CCG is a multi-model developer workflow toolkit built on Claude Code CLI, orchestrating Codex and Gemini with clear role routing (Gemini for frontend, Codex for backend) while Claude handles decisions and code review. It ships 17+ slash commands spanning planning/execution, debugging, testing, review, and Git operations. It also wraps OPSX spec-driven workflows and Claude Agent Teams for parallel implementation, persisting state to files to enable cross-session execution and reduce context window failure modes.

summary.en: UI UX Pro Max is an AI skill that delivers design intelligence for building professional UI/UX across platforms and frameworks. Its core v2.0 capability is a Design System Generator: a reasoning-driven engine that interprets project requirements and outputs a tailored design system, including layout patterns, section structure, CTAs, and style guidance. The repository emphasizes repeatable quality via 100 reasoning rules and 67 curated UI styles, and it ships with CLI tooling (uipro-cli) to integrate design decisions into practical workflows.

summary.en: Prisma is a visual deep multi-agent reasoning engine built on Google Gemini 3. It decomposes complex queries via a Managerâ†’Expertsâ†’Synthesis pipeline, runs specialized experts in parallel, and applies recursive review/refinement to improve rigor. The UI exposes end-to-end reasoning as a live process graph, including expert internal monologues and drafts. It also offers per-stage thinking budgets, Gemini model switching, and local multi-session managementâ€”ideal for complex analysis, design decisions, and architecture/code reasoning.

summary.en: A Claude Codeâ€“centric multi-agent orchestration system for AI-assisted software delivery. It ships modular workflows (/do, /omo, BMAD, SPARV, essentials) to standardize feature development, debugging, and requirements-to-code pipelines. The codeagent wrapper enables multi-backend execution and intelligent routing across Claude, Codex, Gemini, and OpenCode. Installation and updates are streamlined via npx with configurable modules and overwrite-safe upgrades. It also provides security-scanned skill installation plus utilities for PRD scoring, test-case generation, and browser automation.

summary.en: AxonHub is an open-source AI gateway (Go, Docker-ready) that lets you use any existing SDKâ€”OpenAI, Anthropic, and moreâ€”to call 100+ LLMs with zero code changes. It transparently translates API formats so you can switch providers via configuration, reducing vendor lock-in and integration overhead. Built for production, it includes sub-100ms failover, smart load balancing, real-time cost and quota governance with per-request breakdowns, end-to-end tracing for observability, and enterprise-grade RBAC for isolation and control.

summary.en: A multi-agent deep research framework built on Claude Code CLI, reproducing â€œDeep Researchâ€ capabilities via native Skills and Commands. It orchestrates a 7-phase workflow with a Graph of Thoughts controller to manage research paths, launches parallel specialist agents for exploration, and synthesizes outputs into structured reports. A citation validation system rates sources (Aâ€“E) and performs verification to improve trustworthiness. Ideal for technical decision-making, market/industry analysis, and repeatable research pipelines that generate organized artifacts under RESEARCH/[topic]/.

summary.en: KVideo is a modern video aggregation and playback platform built with Next.js 16, React 19, Tailwind CSS v4, and TypeScript. It features a distinctive â€œLiquid Glassâ€ UI system for smooth, depth-rich interactions. The app delivers federated multi-source search with parallel queries and real-time results via Server-Sent Events, plus customizable and subscribable sources with a unified parser layer. Playback is HLS-first with proxy modes, stutter detection, PiP, Chromecast, and mobile-friendly controls. It also includes IPTV (M3U/M3U8) support with stream proxying, plus Douban metadata, recommendations, favorites, and resume history.

summary.en: Prompt Optimizer is a prompt engineering assistant for refining system and user prompts through iterative rewriting and side-by-side evaluation. It provides variable templating, multi-turn conversation tests, and tool/function-calling playgrounds to harden prompts for production formats. The app integrates multiple LLM and image models (OpenAI, Gemini, DeepSeek, Zhipu, SiliconFlow, etc.) and supports T2I and I2I workflows. Built as a client-side app with optional access password, it ships as web, desktop, Chrome extension, Docker, and MCP server integrations. Real-time diff testing helps quantify improvements and choose the best prompt version.

summary.en: CLIProxyAPI turns Gemini CLI, Claude Code, OpenAI Codex (GPT), Qwen Code and iFlow into OpenAI/Gemini/Claude/Codex-compatible API endpoints. It supports OAuth-based login, multi-account round-robin load balancing, streaming and non-streaming responses, tool/function calling, and multimodal inputs (text + images). Designed for CLI and coding clients (SDKs, IDE extensions, Amp), it enables seamless use of multiple providers through one stable gateway, with model mapping and smart fallback routing when models are unavailable.

summary.en: EnsoAI is an Electron/React desktop app that rethinks developer workflow around Git worktrees. It treats each branch as a first-class workspace with its own persistent AI context, enabling parallel work without constant context switching. You can run and switch between multiple agentsâ€”Claude, Gemini, Codex, and other CLI-based or local LLM toolsâ€”across different worktrees simultaneously. Built-in visual source control helps review diffs, stage changes, and manage commits, making multi-branch coding and review faster and more organized.

summary.en: A Codex/Claude-style SKILL workspace focused on designing, standardizing, and maintaining agent capabilities. It ships opinionated documentation and workflow assets: AGENTS.md project rules, an issue-driven planning CSV/template, testing defaults, and an auto-generated MCP tools catalog to improve tool-aware planning. Bridge workflows support collaborating with Claude or Gemini without invoking their CLIs directly. Documentation-first and structure-validated, itâ€™s ideal for teams building reusable agent skills and repeatable delivery processes.

summary.en: AutoGLM-GUI is a modern Web/desktop interface for AutoGLM that turns Android control into a production-grade automation hub. It combines ADB and scrcpy for low-latency live preview and direct touch/gesture interaction, and uses a layered LLM-agent architecture to separate planning from execution for reliable multi-step tasks. It adds cron-style scheduling, conversation history, fast interruption, multi-device isolation, wireless pairing for Android 11+, Docker deployment for 24/7 operation, and an embedded MCP server for integration with tools like Claude Desktop and Cursor.

summary.en: Open-AutoGLM is an open phone-agent model and framework that understands mobile screens with a vision-language model and executes tasks via ADB/HDC automation. Users describe goals in natural language (or voice), and the agent plans and performs multi-step UI actions such as launching apps, searching, tapping, and typing. It includes safety-oriented confirmation for sensitive operations, plus human takeover for login or CAPTCHA flows. Remote ADB debugging over Wiâ€‘Fi/network enables flexible development and device control, and it integrates with Midscene.js for cross-platform UI automation.

summary.en: DesktopFriends is a cross-platform AI Live2D pet built with Vue 3 + TypeScript, shipped via Tauri for macOS and Capacitor for Android. It connects to LLMs (e.g., OpenAI) and uses function calling to trigger each modelâ€™s expressions and motions during replies, including an inner-monologue bubble style. Pets can discover each other on the local network and chat across devices through a Fastify + Socket.io relay, with model package upload and chat log export.

summary.en: Code Switch is a desktop proxy and multi-provider manager for Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini CLI. It runs a local forwarding gateway to route requests through configurable providers with priority levels and automatic failover. It also offers model-name mapping across vendors, detailed usage analytics (requests, tokens, success rate) and cost tracking, plus centralized MCP server and CLI config managementâ€”ideal for developers juggling multiple keys/providers and needing reliability and spend control.

summary.en: Antigravity Quota Watcher is a VS Code extension for Google Antigravity IDE that continuously polls AI model quota usage and surfaces it in the status bar and a rich Dashboard. It auto-detects the local Antigravity server port and authentication, can import existing local login credentials, and highlights low quota via color warnings. The Dashboard lists remaining quota and reset times per model, shows connection and account status, and provides quick actions such as refresh and re-detect. Optional weekly-limit checks send a minimal test request.

summary.en: This repository curates GudaStudio Agent Skills for Claude Code, leveraging Anthropicâ€™s modular â€œAgent Skillsâ€ mechanism to plug in specialized workflows on demand. It enables seamless multi-model collaboration by delegating coding tasks to external CLIs such as OpenAI Codex and Google Gemini for prototyping, debugging, and code review. The repo includes cross-platform installers (Bash/PowerShell), supports user-level and project-level installation, and allows custom target paths, making skill rollout consistent across teams and environments.

summary.zh: dompdf.js åœ¨æµè§ˆå™¨ç«¯å°†ç½‘é¡µ DOM ä¸æ ·å¼ç›´æ¥æ˜ å°„ä¸ºå¯ç¼–è¾‘ã€å¯æ‰“å°çš„çŸ¢é‡ PDFï¼Œæ”¯æŒåˆ†é¡µå¹¶å¯ç”Ÿæˆä¸Šåƒé¡µæ–‡æ¡£ã€‚å®ƒæ”¹é€  html2canvas çš„ canvas æ¸²æŸ“å™¨å¹¶é©±åŠ¨ jsPDF è¾“å‡ºçœŸå® PDFï¼Œé¿å…â€œæˆªå›¾å¼â€å›¾ç‰‡ PDFï¼Œæ–‡ä»¶æ›´å°ã€æ¸…æ™°åº¦æ›´é«˜ã€‚é€‚ç”¨äºå‰ç«¯ä¸€é”®å¯¼å‡ºæŠ¥è¡¨/åˆåŒ/é•¿æ–‡æ¡£ï¼Œä½†å¤æ‚ CSS ä¸è§†è§‰ä¸€è‡´æ€§ä»æœ‰é™ã€‚
summary.en: dompdf.js generates editable, printable vector PDFs directly in the browser by translating DOM structure and computed styles into jsPDF drawing commands. By modifying html2canvasâ€™s canvas renderer, it avoids the common screenshot-to-PDF workflow, producing real PDFs with smaller size and better print quality. It includes pagination and can export documents with thousands of pages, making it suitable for one-click frontend exports such as reports, invoices, and long-form documents. Some CSS is unsupported and visual fidelity may differ from actual rendering.

It also provides multi-channel API routing with random polling, supports both native Gemini endpoints and OpenAI-compatible interfaces, and offers streaming responses plus optional auto-save via the browser File System Access API.

Powered by React 18, TypeScript, and Vite, it delivers multimodal chat (text, voice, images, video), low-latency Live audio/video streaming, web search with citations, and an embedded Python sandbox for code execution. summary.en: Claude Code Hub is a modern team-oriented API proxy for Claude, Codex, Gemini and other OpenAI-compatible providers. It offers unified endpoints, intelligent routing with weights/priority groups, circuit breaking and failover, plus multi-dimensional rate limits and concurrency control powered by Redis atomic scripts. The platform adds user management, pricing and usage analytics dashboards, session caching with decision-chain auditability, and auto-generated OpenAPI 3.1 docs with Swagger/Scalar UIs. Built on Next.js 15, Hono, PostgreSQL and Redis, it ships as a Docker-ready deployment.

summary.en: A modern, frontend-only React 19 + Vite 6 client for interacting with Google Gemini 3 Pro (default: gemini-3-pro-image-preview). It delivers streaming chat with Markdown rendering and multimodal inputs (text plus up to 14 images), including frictionless paste and drag-and-drop uploads. Generated images can be downloaded, automatically collected into a persistent local gallery, and reviewed with prompt details. Advanced options cover model/endpoint overrides, grounding toggle, image resolution/aspect controls, local API key storage, and an arcade â€œwaiting modeâ€ with built-in mini games during long reasoning.

summary.en: banana-slides is an AI-native slide generator built on nano banana pro. It turns a single idea, outline, or per-page description into cohesive, high-quality PPT decks with strong style consistency. Users can upload any template/reference image and import materials such as PDF, DOCX, Markdown, or text; the system parses content and extracts key points, images, and chart cues. â€œVibeâ€ editing enables natural-language, region-level redraws or full-page refinement. Export is one-click to PPTX or PDF, targeting fast decks for teaching, reports, and proposals.

summary.en: Code Switch is a local proxy manager for Claude Code and Codex. It starts an HTTP proxy on port 18100, rewrites CLI configs to a stable localhost endpoint, and enables seamless provider switching without restarting tools. Requests are routed to the highest-priority enabled provider with automatic fallback on failures. It also offers per-request usage/cost tracking, unified management for cc & codex MCP servers, and automatic Claude Skill repository download/installation with custom repos supported. Built with Wails 3 for cross-platform distribution.

summary.en: Gemini-MCP is an MCP server that wraps Googleâ€™s Gemini CLI as a standard Model Context Protocol interface, so Claude Code can invoke Gemini for AI-assisted programming. It enables multi-model collaboration in a local developer workflow, including code generation, review, and stronger front-end design output. The server uses stdio transport and supports quick installation via uv/uvx, making it easy to plug Gemini into Claudeâ€™s tool ecosystem with minimal configuration and predictable tool calls.

summary.en: Claude Relay Service (CRS) is a self-hosted relay/mirror for Claude Code and compatible LLM endpoints, enabling unified access for multiple users without relying on unstable third-party mirrors. It supports multi-account pooling and automatic failover, per-user API keys, detailed token/cost accounting, and a web admin dashboard. Built with Node.js and Redis and shipped with Docker-ready deployment scripts, CRS adds performance optimizations (pooling/cache), rate limiting, access controls, and proxy supportâ€”ideal for privacy-sensitive teams, regions with access limits, or subscription cost sharing (â€œcarpoolingâ€).

summary.en: ccstatusline is a highly customizable statusline formatter for the Claude Code CLI. It adds Powerline-style segments, theming, and an interactive TUI configurator to compose widgets that surface model/session details, Git context (branch/root), token and context usage, timers, and system memory. Recent releases focus on performance via hashed per-config caches and more reliable Git command helpers, plus fixes for Windows UTF-8 piped output. Ideal for developers who want a clean, observable, and personalized terminal workflow while coding with Claude.

summary.en: Flow2API is a FastAPI-based, OpenAI-compatible API gateway that exposes Flowâ€™s media capabilities through a unified interface. It supports text/image-to-image, text/image-to-video, and start/end-frame video workflows. The service includes a multi-token pool with round-robin load balancing, concurrency control, caching strategies, and HTTP/SOCKS5 proxy support. It also automates AT refresh and browser-assisted ST renewal, plus a web admin console for token and configuration management, and Docker-first deployment.

summary.en: RedInk is an end-to-end Xiaohongshu post generator: provide one sentence and it produces an editable outline, a stylistically consistent cover, and batch-generated content pages with optional high concurrency and per-page re-generation. It uses a Flask (Python 3.11+) backend and a Vue 3 + TypeScript frontend. Copywriting is powered by Gemini, while images are generated via Nano Banana Pro. It supports web-based settings, YAML-based multi-provider switching, and one-command Docker self-hosting.

summary.en: An all-in-one workstation for short-video production that combines content planning, AI script generation, batch TTS voice-over with emotion, AI image material composition, and ASR-based subtitle/script extraction, wrapped with project-based management. It supports template-driven batch creation so each video project ships with scripts, images, audio, and captions, plus a frontend for multi-track preview and asset replacement. Best suited for creator studios and ad/matrix operations seeking repeatable pipelines, with Gemini-powered rewriting and containerized deployment.

summary.en: Mole is an all-in-one macOS maintenance CLI that merges deep cleaning, smart app uninstall (including hidden leftovers), disk usage analysis, and live system monitoring into a single binary. It targets real-world space recovery by removing caches, logs, browser residues, installer files, and project build artifacts, while also refreshing caches and system services for performance. Safety features like dry-run previews, whitelists, detailed debug output, and operation logs make it suitable for cautious power users and repeatable housekeeping via Homebrew.

summary.en: MCP Router is a cross-platform desktop app that centralizes management of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. It connects to both local and remote servers and supports multiple setup paths including DXT, JSON, and manual configuration. Contexts can be organized with Projects and Workspace-style profiles, while tools can be toggled per server for precise control. It also provides detailed request logging and basic analytics. Designed as local-first, it keeps logs, configs, and credentials on-device and auditable, enabling quick integration with clients like Claude, Cursor, and more.

summary.en: A cross-platform Bilibili video downloader with a modern Tauri v2 GUI. It supports regular and paid videos, series, movies, and courses, plus search and account features. Downloads are accelerated via segmented fetching with resume, batching, and rate limiting. It also fetches covers, CC subtitles (SRT), and danmaku (XML/JSON) with optional ASS conversion. Built-in NFO scraping downloads poster/fanart for easy import into Emby-like libraries, and it can embed chapters and ad-skip markers into the final media files.

metadata.name: codexmcp

summary.en: CodexMCP is an MCP-based bridge that enables Claude Code and OpenAI Codex to collaborate as a multi-agent coding system. Claude Code focuses on requirements, architecture, and refactoring, while Codex handles implementation, bug hunting, and reviews. Compared with the official Codex MCP, it adds enterprise-grade capabilities such as session persistence, multi-turn context management, parallel task execution, reasoning/trace visibility, and stronger error handling. It fits developer workflows that need iterative planning, patch prototyping, and post-change code review for higher productivity.

summary.en: This generator addresses the lack of HarmonyOS training data in mainstream LLMs by scraping Huaweiâ€™s official best-practice documentation (including SPA parsing) and using Gemini to extract actionable guidelines. It outputs structured CursorRules files organized by modules, covering UI patterns, performance tips, and TypeScript-to-ArkTS migration constraints such as lint rules and syntax restrictions. Developers can directly import the final merged rules into Cursor IDE to obtain more accurate, consistent HarmonyOS code suggestions aligned with official standards.

summary.en: Claude Code Workflow is a JSON-driven multi-agent development framework that codifies reusable workflows with role-based agents and session lifecycle management. It provides an intelligent CLI orchestrator that can route tasks across Claude, Gemini, Qwen, and Codex (auto-select or manual), enabling context-first execution. With a queue scheduler, terminal dashboard monitoring, and template-based workflow editing, it automates end-to-end planning and delivery loops. It fits cadence-style team collaboration, TDD-oriented workflows, and structured requirement breakdown.

summary.en: Desktop Commander is an MCP server for Claude/ChatGPT that enables secure desktop automation: streamed terminal execution, background jobs, and interactive process/session control. It extends filesystem capabilities with fast recursive search (ripgrep), surgical replace/diff-style editing, and full file operations. It also runs code in memory (Python/Node/R), performs instant analysis on CSV/JSON/Excel, and offers native Excel and PDF read/write/edit support. Comprehensive audit logging and dynamic configuration make it practical for real-world dev workflows and automation.

summary.en: MuMuAINovel is an AI-powered novel writing workstation for web-fiction authors. It integrates multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Gemini, Claude) to generate outlines, characters, and world-building, and to rewrite or polish chapters. The app includes visual management for characters, organizations, foreshadowing threads, and chapter relationship graphs to keep plots consistent. A Prompt Workshop enables sharing and importing prompt templates, plus project/card import-export. Built with FastAPI + React and PostgreSQL for multi-user isolation, it ships with Docker for turnkey deployment.

summary.en: BettaFish (WeiYu) is a from-scratch, framework-free Python multi-agent social listening assistant. It continuously crawls 30+ major platforms (Weibo, Xiaohongshu, Douyin, etc.) down to massive comment threads, then runs a composite analytics pipeline that combines specialized agents, fine-tuned/statistical models, and multimodal parsers for short videos and structured search cards. An â€œagent forumâ€ debate mechanism reduces single-model bias and improves decision support. Designed for rapid extension, you can swap tools and prompts to target finance or brand risk.

summary.en: A Gradio-based multimodal video analysis WebUI that combines intelligent keyframe selection, objective visual quality metrics, and high-throughput transcription via Faster-Whisper. It aligns frames with timestamped text to produce structured AI summary reports, and can generate highlight media such as recap videos and GIFs. The system supports a dual inference backendâ€”local Ollama models or OpenAI-compatible cloud APIsâ€”making it suitable for lecture review, rough-cut editing, content auditing, and video fact-checking workflows.

metadata.name: cc-switch
metadata.description: A cross-platform desktop All-in-One assistant tool for Claude Code, Codex, OpenCode & Gemini CLI.

summary.zh: CC Switch æ˜¯åŸºäº Tauri 2 çš„è·¨å¹³å°æ¡Œé¢åŠ©æ‰‹ï¼Œå°† Claude Codeã€Codexã€OpenCode ä¸ Gemini CLI ç»Ÿä¸€åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ª GUI ä¸­ç®¡ç†ä¸å¯åŠ¨ã€‚å®ƒèšç„¦å¤šå·¥å…·å¹¶å­˜åœºæ™¯ï¼Œæä¾›é…ç½®ä¸è´¦å·/å¯†é’¥é›†ä¸­ç»´æŠ¤ã€ç¯å¢ƒåˆ‡æ¢ä¸ä¸€é”®è¿è¡Œï¼Œé™ä½å‘½ä»¤è¡Œé—¨æ§›ï¼Œé€‚åˆå¼€å‘è€…åœ¨ä¸åŒæ¨¡å‹ä¸æ¸ é“é—´å¿«é€Ÿåˆ‡æ¢å¹¶ä¿æŒç¨³å®šå·¥ä½œæµã€‚
summary.en: CC Switch is a cross-platform desktop assistant built with Tauri 2 that unifies Claude Code, Codex, OpenCode, and Gemini CLI into a single GUI. It targets real-world workflows where multiple AI coding CLIs coexist, centralizing configuration, credentials, and runtime environment management. By enabling quick profile switching and one-click launching, it reduces CLI friction and helps developers move between models/providers smoothly. The result is a more consistent, reliable daily setup for AI-assisted coding across Windows, macOS, and Linux.

summary.en: MoneyPrinterTurbo turns a topic or keywords into an HD short video end-to-end: script generation, stock footage sourcing, subtitle creation, voice synthesis, background music selection, and final composition. It ships with both a Web UI and an API, built on a clean MVC structure for maintainability and customization. The pipeline supports vertical/horizontal formats, multiple resolutions, batch generation, and clip duration control. It integrates with many LLM providers (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Gemini, Ollama, etc.), fitting content marketing and creator automation workflows.

metadata.name: rustdesk
metadata.description: An open-source remote desktop application designed for self-hosting, as an alternative to TeamViewer.

summary.zh: RustDesk æ˜¯ Rust ç¼–å†™çš„å¼€æºè¿œç¨‹æ¡Œé¢ï¼Œä¸»æ‰“è‡ªæ‰˜ç®¡æ›¿ä»£ TeamViewerã€‚è·¨å¹³å°å®¢æˆ·ç«¯å¼€ç®±å³ç”¨ï¼Œå¯éƒ¨ç½²è‡ªå»º rendezvous/relay æœåŠ¡å™¨å®Œæˆç©¿é€ä¸ä¸­ç»§ï¼Œæ•°æ®ä¸è®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶ç•™åœ¨æœ¬åœ°ã€‚Flutter/Sciter UIï¼Œæ”¯æŒè¿œç¨‹æ§åˆ¶ã€æ–‡ä»¶ä¼ è¾“ä¸æƒé™ç®¡ç†ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºä¼ä¸šè¿ç»´ã€è¿œç¨‹ååŠ©ä¸åˆè§„åœºæ™¯ã€‚
summary.en: RustDesk is an open-source remote desktop and remote support application written in Rust, built for self-hosting as a TeamViewer alternative. It provides cross-platform clients (desktop and mobile) that work out of the box, while letting you run your own rendezvous and relay servers for NAT traversal and traffic forwarding. This keeps identity, routing, and access policies under your control, improving privacy and compliance. The UI is built with Flutter (Sciter legacy) and includes interactive control, file transfer, and session/permission management.

summary.en: VoiceCraft is a free web + API speech platform combining Microsoft Edge Text-to-Speech with SiliconFlow Speech-to-Text. It provides 20+ Chinese neural voices, multilingual UI, and controls for speed, pitch, and speaking style, with downloadable audio and editable transcripts. The HTTP endpoints follow the OpenAI TTS API shape, simplifying integration into apps, bots, and automation workflows. Built for quick serverless rollout on Cloudflare Workers, it fits narration, accessibility reading, short-video/podcast dubbing, and meeting transcription at low operational cost.

summary.en: Spec Kit is an open-source toolkit for Spec-Driven Development, centered on the Specify CLI and /speckit assistant commands. It turns product scenarios and desired outcomes into executable specs that can drive AI agents to generate implementations, tests, and supporting docs. The workflow starts by defining a project â€œconstitutionâ€ (quality, testing, UX, performance rules), then iteratively specifies what/why before coding. Itâ€™s well-suited for bootstrapping new apps or stabilizing refactors with predictable, repeatable delivery.

summary.en: RequestManager is an HTTP request management and automation platform built with FastAPI and React (TypeScript). It imports requests from Fiddler Raw dumps or cURL commands, provides full CRUD with tags/categories, and runs them as scheduled jobs with periodic triggers, multi-thread concurrency, and configurable retry policies. The system includes proxy pool management with automatic rotation, detailed execution history and statistics, plus real-time task monitoring and control. It fits API testing, batch API operations, and crawler-style request orchestration workflows.

summary.en: mise is an all-in-one front-end for developer environments. It manages versions of hundreds of tools across languages (asdf-like), provides directory-scoped environment variables and .env loading (direnv-style), and includes a task runner similar to make for build/test workflows. After shell activation, it exposes real executable paths instead of shims, improving reliability and debuggability. Itâ€™s ideal for polyglot teams needing consistent toolchains, env configuration, and repeatable tasks across local machines and CI.

summary.en: This repo is a front-end â€œreturn-address screenshotâ€ simulator for SF Express and other e-commerce/shipping platforms. It helps users generate a realistic return-page layout from standardized address details, enabling screenshot-based proof commonly used in return-shipping workflows and discount channels. Built with HTML + JavaScript (no backend), it supports online hosting or local static serving, and includes clipboard import/export plus one-click reset. A single template is designed to fit multiple platforms such as JD, STO, and ZTO.

summary.en: Sketch2Motion turns a photo, doodle, or sketch into a polished â€œdrawingâ€ animation. It converts the input image to a sketch, vectorizes it into SVG paths, then renders a high-quality MP4 with Manim by animating subpaths in sequence. The app also prepends the last frame to create a brief intro pause for smoother playback. A Gradio web UI exposes key controlsâ€”duration, subpath delay ratio, scale, and multiple drawing stylesâ€”making it practical for explainers, educational visuals, and quick motion content.

summary.en: A Go + Next.js/React end-to-end WebRTC P2P transfer tool. It uses WebSocket only for signaling, while files, text, and screen sharing stream directly over WebRTC DataChannels so payloads never pass through or persist on the server. It features multi-file concurrent transfer, ACK-based reliable chunking, connection recovery, and customizable STUN/TURN for NAT traversal, plus responsive UI and easy Docker or single-binary cross-platform deployment.

summary.en: Cunzhi is a cross-platform MCP tool that prevents assistants from ending conversations too early by triggering a continuation popup at the right moment. It adds project-scoped memory for coding conventions and personal preferences, provides Markdown-friendly interaction and a dedicated settings UI, and helps generate ready-to-use prompts for clients like Claude Desktop. It also integrates ACE-powered semantic code search, enabling deeper repository understanding and longer, more effective problem-solving sessions across macOS, Windows, and Linux.

summary.en: xiaohongshu-mcp is an MCP server that lets LLM agents operate Xiaohongshu (RED) via tool calls. It supports login and session checks, publishing image posts (URL or local paths) and local video uploads, keyword search, home-feed recommendations, and rich note retrieval including engagement metrics and nested comments. It can also auto-post comments and fetch user profile pages. The project exposes HTTP APIs alongside MCP, ships Docker images for deployment, and targets automated content operations and lightweight data-collection workflows.

summary.en: Claude Code Router turns Claude Code into a customizable routing layer for AI coding infrastructure. It proxies requests and routes them to different models/providers based on task needs (background work, deep thinking, long context), with support for OpenRouter, DeepSeek, Ollama, Gemini, Volcengine, and SiliconFlow. It also provides request/response transformers and a plugin system to adapt payloads across providers. Models can be switched on the fly via the /model command, managed via CLI, and automated in CI with GitHub Actions.

metadata.description: Shrimp Task Manager is a task tool built for AI Agents, emphasizing chain-of-thought, reflection, and style consistency. It converts natural language into structured dev tasks with dependency tracking and iterative refinement, enabling agent-like developer behavior in reasoning AI systems.

summary.en: Shrimp Task Manager is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for agentic software development. It turns natural-language goals into structured development tasks with decomposition, dependency tracking, and iterative refinement. By persisting task state across sessions, it preserves context under token limits and enables â€œdeveloper-likeâ€ agent behavior. Built to integrate with MCP-compatible clients such as Claude Code, it emphasizes reflection and consistent writing/coding style via templates, providing guided workflows for planning, execution, and verification.

summary.en: An AI-assisted Xianyu monitoring and scraping tool built on Playwright, enabling multi-task real-time or scheduled tracking. Users can create tasks with natural language and leverage multimodal LLMs to analyze listings (text + images) and decide whether to notify. It ships with a full web admin UI for tasks, accounts, prompts, logs, and result browsing, plus advanced filters (region, price, recency), cron scheduling, account/proxy rotation with retries, and rich notification channels (ntfy, WeCom, Bark, Telegram, webhooks).

summary.en: An AI-driven Xianyu (Goofish) product monitoring system that continuously crawls listings by user-defined keywords and price ranges. It uses Playwright for JavaScript-rendered pages, plus proxy and cookie pools to improve robustness. A large language model analyzes each item, produces recommendation decisions and explanations, and stores structured results in SQLite. FastAPI provides REST APIs and a built-in web console for task management, settings, logs, and filtering. Notifications (e.g., email) deliver relevant deals in near real time.

summary.en: A WeChat-style File Transfer Assistant rebuilt as a modern Web/PWA on Cloudflare Workers with the Hono framework. It delivers real-time chat and multi-device sync via SSE, plus drag-and-drop and clipboard uploads for files up to 10MB. Messages are persisted in Cloudflare D1 (SQLite) and files in R2 object storage for scalable, globally distributed access. Security is handled with password protection and JWT sessions, while PWA offline caching enables app-like usage and fast edge responses.

metadata.name: AstrBot
metadata.description: Agentic IM Chatbot infrastructure that integrates lots of IM platforms, LLMs, plugins and AI feature, and can be your openclaw alternative. âœ¨

summary.en: AstrBot is an open-source, all-in-one agentic chatbot infrastructure for instant messaging. It unifies integrations across mainstream IM platforms, multiple LLM providers, and tool-based AI capabilities, enabling scalable conversational workflows. With a plugin marketplace and extensible architecture, developers can rapidly add skills, automations, and custom agents. Shipping with Docker-friendly deployment and production-minded components, AstrBot fits personal automation, community operations, customer support, and team assistantsâ€”positioning itself as a practical open alternative to OpenClaw.

metadata.name: zcf
metadata.description: Zero-Config Code Flow for Claude code & Codex

summary.en: ZCF (Zero-Config Code Flow) is an npm-powered CLI that bootstraps Claude Code and Codex with a single command. It automates installation, workflow provisioning, provider/key presets, API/CCR routing, and MCP integration, minimizing manual setup and copy-paste configuration. The tool offers a bilingual interactive menu plus non-interactive flags for scripting and CI usage, and supports updating workflows independently. It targets developers and teams who want a fast, reproducible, and stable AI coding environment across multiple providers.

summary.en: Twocast generates short, two-person conversational podcasts (3â€“9 minutes) from a topic, URL, documents (PDF/DOC/TXT), or curated list pages. It outputs a complete packageâ€”outline, script, and downloadable audioâ€”making it practical for news digestion, education recaps, and bilingual content repurposing. The pipeline combines LLM drafting via OpenRouter with multilingual TTS providers (Fish Audio, Minimax, Google Gemini), plus Textract-based text extraction and FFmpeg processing for audio assembly. Local and Docker deployments are supported with Postgres/Drizzle.

summary.en: NarratoAI is an end-to-end AI workflow for movie/short-drama narration and automated video editing. It uses LLMs to draft commentary scripts, then drives a one-click pipeline covering clip selection/editing, voiceover (TTS), and subtitle generation. The project also adds practical creator features such as multi-provider model routing via LiteLLM, video understanding with Qwen2-VL, and voice cloning through IndexTTS2, enabling fast production of narrated recaps and remix-style cuts for short-form video channels.

summary.en: An AI-powered interactive novel generator built with React/Vite, where users pick a genre and steer the plot through branching choices. To reduce LLM formatting failures, it parses responses via robust keyword markers instead of strict JSON. The app maintains in-session reading history and introduces â€œstructure thinkingâ€ (outline planning and periodic recalibration) plus lightweight user preference analysis to adapt future scenes and options. Ideal for interactive fiction prototyping, narrative UX demos, and experimenting with OpenAI-compatible chat completion endpoints.

summary.en: A self-hosted AI-driven public opinion and trend monitoring system that aggregates multi-platform hot lists and RSS feeds, then filters noise with precise keyword rules. It generates translated, LLM-based digests and smart alerts, pushing insights to multiple channels (WeChat, Feishu, DingTalk, Telegram, email, Slack, etc.). With MCP integration, it enables conversational analysis, sentiment insights, and trend forecasting. Deploy fast via Docker or GitHub Pages while keeping full data ownership locally or in your own cloud.

metadata.name: ioe
metadata.description: One-Stop Retail Inventory Solution

summary.zh: IOEåŸºäºDjangoçš„ä¸€ç«™å¼é›¶å”®åº“å­˜ç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œé›†å•†å“/åº“å­˜/ç›˜ç‚¹/æ”¶é“¶é”€å”®/ä¼šå‘˜ç§¯åˆ†ä¸æŠ¥è¡¨åˆ†æäºä¸€ä½“ï¼Œæ”¯æŒå¤šæ”¯ä»˜ã€ä½åº“å­˜é¢„è­¦ã€å®¡è®¡æƒé™ä¸Dockeréƒ¨ç½²ï¼Œé€‚ç”¨äºé—¨åº—ä¸å°ä»“åº“æ•°å­—åŒ–ç®¡ç†ã€‚
summary.en: IOE is a Django-based, one-stop inventory management system tailored for retail stores and small warehouses. It covers product cataloging, real-time stock tracking, inbound/outbound adjustments, and structured stocktaking with review and discrepancy reports. Built-in POS-style sales flows support multiple payment methods, discounts, and returns. Membership features include tiers, points, balance top-ups, and purchase history. Analytics dashboards provide sales trends, inventory health, and profit insights, with role-based access control, audit logs, and Docker-ready deployment.

summary.en: An open-source, portable Windows C drive cleaner that scans and removes temp files, caches, update leftovers, logs, and more, plus a large-file finder to quickly locate space hogs. Unlike risky cleaners, it emphasizes safety with a dry-run preview mode, protected-path checks, and automatic backup/restore before deletion. Built in Python under the MIT license, it targets routine maintenance and low-disk-space troubleshooting on Windows 7/8/10/11.

summary.en: LibreTV is a lightweight video search-and-watch platform that aggregates multiple third-party sources and delivers smoother playback via a server-side HLS proxy. It requires no registration, supports optional password protection through an environment variable, and can be deployed in minutes on Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare Pages/Functions, Render, or Docker. The project is compatible with Apple CMS V10 APIs, making it easy to plug in custom content providers. Ideal for quickly running a private streaming portal and learning serverless streaming proxy patterns.

summary.en: Ruanyf/weekly is a long-running Chinese tech digest published every Friday. Each issue curates high-signal links across software engineering, AI, products, security, and the wider tech industry, with brief commentary and a stable Markdown archive for search and reuse. Submissions and discussions are crowdsourced via GitHub Issues, effectively turning the repo into an open editorial workflow. It also hosts a popular â€œWhoâ€™s hiringâ€ thread as a free job board for developers and interns. Ideal for staying current and discovering tools.

summary.en: Folo is an AI-powered reader built for information subscription. It aggregates content from RSS feeds, websites, and social sources, then uses AI to generate concise summaries, extract key points, and assist with translation for faster comprehension. With cross-device syncing across mobile and desktop, it fits daily reading workflows from quick scans to deep dives. Offline access, saving, tagging, and search help turn noisy streams into a personal, searchable knowledge base for ongoing learning and research.

summary.zh: LLMAI-writer æ˜¯é¢å‘å°è¯´å†™ä½œçš„ AI å·¥ä½œå°ï¼Œè¦†ç›–ä»å¤§çº²ã€äººç‰©åˆ°ç« èŠ‚ç”Ÿæˆä¸æ¶¦è‰²çš„å…¨æµç¨‹ã€‚å†…ç½®æç¤ºè¯æ¨¡æ¿ä¸ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡æ„ŸçŸ¥ç”Ÿæˆï¼Œæ”¯æŒç« èŠ‚æ‹–æ‹½æ’åºä¸è‡ªåŠ¨ç¼–å·ã€‚å…¼å®¹ GPT/Claude/Gemini åŠ DeepSeekã€SiliconFlowã€Ollama æœ¬åœ°æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œå¹¶æä¾›çŸ¥è¯†åº“å¯¼å…¥ä¸å‘é‡æ£€ç´¢ã€äººç‰©å…³ç³»å›¾ä¸ç»Ÿè®¡åˆ†æï¼Œé€‚åˆé•¿ç¯‡è¿è½½ä¸å›¢é˜Ÿè§„åˆ’ã€‚
summary.en: LLMAI-writer is an AI-assisted novel writing workstation that supports the full pipeline: outline planning, character design, chapter drafting, analysis, and polishing. It provides prompt templates, context-aware chapter generation across neighboring chapters, drag-and-drop structure management, and automatic numbering. The tool integrates multiple LLM providers (OpenAI GPT, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini) plus DeepSeek/ModelScope, SiliconFlow, and local Ollama models via OpenAI-compatible APIs with streaming output. It also includes a RAG-style knowledge base with embeddings and vector search, character relationship visualization, and writing statistics for long-form projects.

summary.en: MTranServer is an ultra-lightweight offline machine translation server designed for fast, private, self-hosted deployment without a GPU. After the first run auto-downloads and loads language-pair models, typical requests respond in about 50 ms. It offers one-click desktop apps for Windows/macOS/Linux, plus npm and Docker Compose deployments. The service targets local and intranet use cases where data privacy matters and costs must be controlled, and it exposes compatible endpoints for DeepL, DeepLX, Immersive Translate, and other translation plugins.

summary.en: Get Jobs is a Java 21 (Gradle) automation assistant for submitting resumes across major Chinese job platforms (Boss Zhipin, 51job, Liepin, Zhilian). Built on Selenium with auto ChromeDriver handling and long-lived cookie sessions, it reduces repetitive manual steps. A web-based GUI centralizes configuration and execution. Key capabilities include AI-based JD matching and personalized greeting generation (Boss), smart filters for inactive HR/headhunters/salary targets, auto-updated company blacklists, and real-time WeCom webhook notifications for delivery status.

summary.en: Gemini Token Manager is a Node.js service that manages a pool of Gemini API tokens and distributes traffic via load balancing. It offers a RESTful API and an admin UI, supports Docker deployment with persistent storage, and auto-initializes data files. The enhanced proxy layer can forward Google GenAI and OpenAI API requests, including SSE streaming responses, with detailed request/response logging and better error handling. It also includes bulk key operations such as import, delete, validation, and selective export.

summary.en: RedNote-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing RedNote (XiaoHongShu/XHS). It uses Playwright to automate interactive login and persists cookies for authenticated access. The server exposes tools for keyword-based note search and fetching note content by URL, designed to integrate with MCP clients like Cursor over stdio. Itâ€™s suited for letting AI assistants retrieve, summarize, and analyze XHS content via a local, scriptable CLI workflow.

metadata.name: ACL4SSR

summary.zh: åŸºäº ACL4SSR äºŒæ¬¡å®šåˆ¶çš„ Clash/ClashVerge åˆ†æµè§„åˆ™ä¸è„šæœ¬ï¼Œæ•´åˆå»å¹¿å‘Šã€GFWList ä¸è§„åˆ™ç¢ç‰‡ï¼Œå¯ç›´æ¥ç²˜è´´åˆ° ClashVerge å…¨å±€æ‰©å±•æˆ–æŒ‡å®šè®¢é˜…è„šæœ¬ã€‚å¹¶è¡¥å…… IPv6 è§„åˆ™ä¸åˆ†ç»„ï¼Œä¾¿äºæŒ‰åœºæ™¯ç²¾ç»†è·¯ç”±ã€ç»Ÿä¸€ç®¡ç†ä¸æŒç»­ç»´æŠ¤ã€‚
summary.en: A personalized fork of ACL4SSR providing curated rule sets and a ClashVerge Script for Clash-based clients. It bundles ad-blocking rules, GFWList routing, and reusable rule fragments, and can be pasted directly into ClashVerge global extensions or per-subscription scripts. The project also adds IPv6-specific rules and dedicated policy groups, enabling finer traffic steering across common scenarios while keeping configuration maintainable and easy to iterate for daily proxy usage.

summary.en: A modular automation toolkit for JD.com accounts, providing simulated login and cookie/session management, personal order crawling with persistence/export, and automated order reviews that post five-star ratings with text and images. It targets personal data backup, order analytics, and workflow efficiency. Components are separated into focused scripts (login manager, data exporter, auto evaluator) so users can integrate only what they need and extend it for custom pipelines or automation tasks.

summary.en: A Python-based service for automated Cursor account registration and lifecycle management. It integrates tempmail.plus disposable mailboxes with Cloudflare catch-all forwarding to receive verification emails, then drives a headless Chrome workflow to complete sign-up. Built on FastAPI, it exposes endpoints to create accounts, list all accounts, fetch a random account, and perform health checks, plus an optional built-in UI and OpenAPI docs (Swagger/ReDoc). Account data is persisted via SQLite using aiosqlite for easy local development and debugging.

summary.en: Deep Research is a privacy-first deep research app that orchestrates multiple LLMs and web search to produce detailed reports in minutes. It separates â€œThinkingâ€ and â€œTaskâ€ models to balance depth and speed, supports iterative re-research from any stage, and adds local knowledge base ingestion plus one-click knowledge graph generation. Built as a Next.js PWA, it deploys easily to Vercel or Cloudflare. It also exposes SSE streaming APIs and an MCP server, enabling integration with external tools and agent workflows.

summary.en: A modern Next.js 14 + TypeScript web UI for interacting with FAL.AI services (e.g., image generation) through a clean, responsive interface. It focuses on secure API key handling, a server-side proxy to prevent credential exposure, and built-in rate limiting. Performance is enhanced with React Server Components, streaming responses for long-running AI jobs, lazy loading, and optimized image delivery. Ideal for creators and teams who want a deployable front-end to quickly prototype and operate FAL.AI-powered workflows on Vercel.

summary.en: DiffRhythm is the first open-sourced diffusion-based music model able to generate full-length songs end-to-end, delivering a complete track in about 285 seconds via latent diffusion. It supports text-based style prompts without audio references, instrumental-only generation, and structured song continuation/editing. Version 1.2 improves arrangement richness, audio quality, and reduces repetition/omission artifacts. The project targets rapid music creation workflows, product prototyping, and research on controllable, structure-aware generative music systems.

metadata.name: wasp
metadata.description: The batteries-included full-stack framework for the AI era. Develop JS/TS web apps (React, Node.js, and Prisma) using declarative code that abstracts away complex full-stack features like auth, background jobs, RPC, email sending, end-to-end type safety, single-command deployment, and more.

summary.zh: Waspæ˜¯é¢å‘AIæ—¶ä»£çš„â€œç”µæ± é½å…¨â€å…¨æ ˆæ¡†æ¶ï¼Œç”¨å£°æ˜å¼.waspè§„èŒƒä¸²è”Reactã€Node.jsä¸Prismaï¼Œå†…ç½®è®¤è¯ã€RPCã€ä»»åŠ¡é˜Ÿåˆ—ã€é‚®ä»¶ã€ç«¯åˆ°ç«¯ç±»å‹å®‰å…¨ä¸ä¸€é”®éƒ¨ç½²ï¼Œæ˜¾è‘—å‡å°‘æ ·æ¿å¹¶æ”¯æŒä»»æ„å¹³å°éƒ¨ç½²ï¼Œé€‚åˆå¿«é€Ÿäº¤ä»˜ç”Ÿäº§çº§Webåº”ç”¨ã€‚
summary.en: Wasp (Web Application Specification) is a batteries-included, Rails-like full-stack framework for building JS/TS web apps with React, Node.js, and Prisma. You describe the app via a declarative .wasp spec and implement only business logic in React/Node, while Wasp generates and connects auth, RPC, background jobs, email sending, end-to-end type safety, and smart caching/invalidation. It optimizes for fast production delivery with minimal boilerplate, single-command deployment, and no provider lock-in, giving AI agents clearer structure and guardrails.

summary.en: Tuboshu is an Electron-based tool that turns any website into a standalone desktop app with one click. It supports multi-instance launching with account isolation, global hotkeys for instant show/hide, and deep customization including window sizing, icons, shortcuts, and JavaScript injection. Apps can be packaged as executables for Windows, macOS, and Linux, with privacy-friendly local-only configuration storage. Ideal for multi-site workspaces, multi-account operations, and lightweight web container setups.

summary.en: Manuscript and online e-book for â€œFlutter in Action (2nd Edition)â€, updated regularly and written to take developers from fundamentals to advanced practice. It covers Flutter/Dart UI construction with core widgets and layout, event handling and gestures, animations, custom components, file and network I/O, internationalization, and deeper Flutter framework internals. A simplified GitHub client app serves as a capstone to connect topics into a realistic end-to-end development flow. Rich examples and illustrations are included, with companion code planned after the draft is finalized.

summary.en: LuminaBrush is an interactive illumination-drawing tool for text-to-image diffusion workflows, enabling users to steer lighting with simple scribbles. It uses a two-stage design: first normalizing an input image into a â€œuniformly-litâ€ representation, then synthesizing user-guided illumination effects on top of it. This decomposition simplifies learning and improves stability versus a single-stage lighting model. Training leverages relighting via synthesized random normals and large-scale paired data mined from in-the-wild images. The uniform-lit stage can also serve as a standalone delighting/lighting-normalization utility.

summary.en: A Vue 3 idle cultivation game template built with Vite, Pinia, and Naive UI. It delivers a full gameplay loop: character progression, encounters, exploration, inventory, achievements, pets and gear with upgrade paths, alchemy, gacha, plus GM tools and data management. Ideal for prototyping idle games and validating system/economy design, with both NPM and Docker-Compose deployment options.

summary.en: This repository curates a living directory of products built by Chinese independent developers, focusing on ready-to-use websites and apps (not dev tools or forum-style sites). Entries are labeled by lifecycle statusâ€”building, launched, or unmaintainedâ€”and organized into main, programmer, and game editions for quick discovery. It helps makers find inspiration, run market/competitor research, and gain lightweight exposure. Contributions are crowdsourced via pull requests and issues. Each item links to the creator and product page for fast scanning.
